alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 12:38PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern San Juan County through 115 PM MDT... At 1237 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from 9 miles north of Blanding to 17 miles east of Fry Canyon. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Blanding around 1245 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 44 and 66. Utah 95 between mile markers 94 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah
